organisation_id.description: Unique ID of the organisation this resource is created by

account_classification.description: Is the account business or personal?

account_matching_opt_out.description: Is the account opted out of account matching, e.g. CoP?

account_number.description: Account number of the account. A unique number will automatically be generated if not provided.

alternative_bank_account_names.description: - deprecated - Alternative account names. Used for Confirmation of Payee matching.

alternative_names.description: Alternative names. Used for Confirmation of Payee matching.

bank_account_name.description: - deprecated - Primary account name. Used for Confirmation of Payee matching. Required if confirmation_of_payee_enabled is true for the organisation.

bank_id.description: Local country bank identifier. In the UK this is the sort code.

bank_id_code.description: ISO 20022 code used to identify the type of bank ID being used

base_currency.description: ISO 4217 code used to identify the base currency of the account

bic.description: SWIFT BIC in either 8 or 11 character format

country.description: ISO 3166-1 code used to identify the domicile of the account

customer_id.description: A free-format reference that can be used to link this account to an external system

iban.description: IBAN of the account. Will be calculated from other fields if not supplied.

name.description: Account holder names (for example title, first name, last name). Used for Confirmation of Payee matching.

secondary_identification.description: Secondary identification, e.g. building society roll number. Used for Confirmation of Payee.

switched.description: Indicates whether the account has been switched using the Current Account Switch Service.

tax_residency.description: ISO 3166-1 code used to identify the domicile of the account

name.description: Actor names (for example title, first name, last name). Used for Confirmation of Payee matching.

residency.description: ISO 3166-1 code used to identify the domicile of the actor

organisation_id.description: Unique ID of the organisation this resource is created by

account_id.description: ID of the account this event relates to

reason.description: Failure reason. Should only be present when description is failed

x-description.sepa: Must be a BIC

bank_party_id.description: Identifier of the financial institution which services the account

AccountNumberCode.description: The type of identification given at `account_number` attribute

x-description.fps: `BBAN` for domestic beneficiaries and debtors, `IBAN` for debtor if inbound payment originated overseas
x-description.sepa: Must be `IBAN`

account_events.description: Events related to the lifecycle of this account

master_account.description: ID of the master account related to this account

record_type.description: Type of record that this ACE gives access to

role_id.description: Role ID of the role that this ACE belongs to

organisation_id.description: Unique ID of the organisation this resource is created by

action_time.description: Timestamp when the change was requested

actioned_by.description: User ID of the user who requested the change

after_data.description: Snapshot of what the data would be after the change (empty if the request was to DELETE a record)

before_data.description: Snapshot of the data before the change (empty if the request was to CREATE a new record)

description.description: Textual description of the change being made

record_id.description: ID of the resource that is being changed

record_type.description: Type of the resource that is being changed

organisation_id.description: Unique ID of the organisation this resource is created by
Unique ID of the organisation this resource is created by

BankIdCode.description: The type of identification provided at `bank_id` attribute. Must be ISO code as listed in the [External Code Sets spreadsheet](https://www.iso20022.org/external_code_list.page)

x-description.fps: Always `GBDSC` (GB Domestic Sort Code) for beneficiary. `GBDSC` for debtor for outbound payments and inbound payment originated from a domestic account, `SWBIC` (SWIFT BIC) for debtor if inbound payment originated overseas
x-description.sepa: Always has to be `SWBIC` (SWIFT BIC)

x-description.fps: UK sort code when `bank_id_code` is `GBDSC`. BIC8/11 if `bank_id_code` is `SWBIC`
x-description.sepa: Must be a BIC

bank_party_id.description: Identifier of the financial institution which services the account

bearer_code.description: Specifies which party/parties will bear the charges associated with the processing of the payment transaction. Can be one of the following: `DEBT`, `CRED`, `SHAR` or `SLEV`

x-description.sepa: Only `SLEV` is allowed. If not set, will be defaulted to `SLEV`.

receiver_charges_amount.description: Transaction charges due to the receiver of the transaction. Requires 1 to 2 decimal places. Must be > 0.

receiver_charges_currency.description: Currency of `receiver_charges_amount`. Currency code as defined in [ISO 4217](http://www.iso.org/iso/home/standards/currency_codes.htm).

items.description: List of transaction charges due to the sender of the transaction

amount.description: Amount of each transaction charge due to the sender of the transaction. Requires 1 to 2 decimal places. Must be > 0.

currency.description: Currency of `amount`. Currency code as defined in [ISO 4217](http://www.iso.org/iso/home/standards/currency_codes.htm).

amount.description: Amount that is being returned/kept. The sum of `recall-amount.amount` and `charges-amount.amount` have to equal the original payment amount.
Amount of money moved between the instructing agent and instructed agent

account_name.description: Name of beneficiary as given with account

account_type.description: The type of the account given with `beneficiary_party.account_number`. Single digit number. Only required if requested by the beneficiary party. Defaults to 0.

country.description: Country of the beneficiary address, ISO 3166 format country code

clearing_id.description: Unique identifier for organisations collecting payments

currency.description: Currency of the transaction amount. Currency code as defined in [ISO 4217](http://www.iso.org/iso/home/standards/currency_codes.htm)

account_name.description: Name of debtor as given with account

account_number.description: Debtor account number. Allows upper case and numeric characters.

country.description: Country of debtor address. ISO 3166 format country code"

numeric_reference.description: Numeric reference field, see scheme specific descriptions for usage

payment_scheme.description: Clearing infrastructure through which the operation instruction is to be processed. Default for given organisation ID is used if left empty. Has to be a valid [scheme identifier](http://draft-api-docs.form3.tech/api.html#enumerations-schemes).

processing_date.description: Date on which the operation is to be debited from the debtor account. Formatted according to ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.

scheme_processing_date.description: Date on which the operation is processed by the scheme. Only used if different from `processing_date`.

scheme_status.description: This reference is used by the receiving party to identify whether the related DDI would have been electronic (AUDDIS) or paperbased.

unique_scheme_id.description: The scheme-specific unique transaction ID. Populated by the scheme.

organisation_id.description: Unique ID of the organisation this resource is created by

direct_debit_submission.description: The submission resource related to the direct debit

scheme_status_code.description: Scheme-specific status (if submission has been submitted to a scheme)

transaction_start_datetime.description: Time the request was received by Form3. Used to compute the total transaction time of an operation.

organisation_id.description: Unique ID of the organisation this resource is created by

inverse_rate.description: The inverse of the provider rate

provider_rate.description: The rate that the user gets for this deal

id.description: The FX Deal Submission for this FX Deal
The Party that initiated this FxDeal

FXDealSubmissionProviderID.description: The ID of the FX provider's associated resource

FXDealSubmissionPurposesCoded.description: The purpose code of the FX Deal

id.description: The FX Deal that is being submitted

FXDealSubmissionStatus.description: The current state of the FX Deal Submission

FXDealSubmissionStatusCode.description: The status code of the current state of the FX Deal Submission

FXDealSubmissionStatusReason.description: Plain-text description of the status attribute. May provide additional information in case of a submission error.

FXProcessingDate.description: The date for which the rate would be valid

amount.description: The amount of currency to sell

currency.description: The currency the party wants to sell

amount.description: The amount of currency to buy

currency.description: The currency the party wants to buy

FXWarning.description: A warning message when processing_date date was updated

status.description: Status of the service. Can either be `up` or `down`.

bank_party_id.description: Identifier of the financial institution which services the account

Self.description: An optional link to the account at the Read/Write Account Information API

first.description: Link to the first resource in the list

last.description: Link to the last resource in the list

next.description: Link to the next resource in the list

prev.description: Link to the previous resource in the list

record_type.description: The type of resource contained in `data`

ErrorCode.description: Low level textual error code, e.g., UK.OBIE.Field.Missing

Message.description:
A description of the error that occurred. e.g., 'A mandatory field isn't supplied' or 'RequestedExecutionDateTime must be in future'
OBIE doesn't standardise this field

Path.description: Recommended but optional reference to the JSON Path of the field with error, e.g., Data.Initiation.InstructedAmount.Currency

Url.description: URL to help remediate the problem, or provide more information, or to API Reference, or help etc

OBErrorResponse1.description: An array of detail error codes, and messages, and URLs to documentation to help remediation.

Code.description: High level textual error code, to help categorize the errors.

Id.description: A unique reference for the error instance, for audit purposes, in case of unknown/unclassified errors.

Message.description: Brief Error message, e.g., 'There is something wrong with the request parameters provided'

OBExternalAccountType1Code.description: Specifies the type of account (personal or business).

organisation_id.description: Unique ID of the organisation this resource is created by

cop_endpoint.description: URL where the participant Confirmation of Payee endpoint may be found

cop_requests_active.description: Whether the participant is currently accepting Confirmation of Payee requests

amount.description: Amount of money moved between the instructing agent and instructed agent

x-description.bacs: Field8, automatically converted to pence when submitted to Bacs. Maximum value `20000000.00`.
x-description.fps: Format uses decimal point. Maximum two decimals, value must be > 0. Maximum value `250000.00`.
x-description.sepa: Interbank settlement amount, must have 2 decimal places. Maximum value `15000.00`.
x-description.swift: Field 32A: Interbank Settled Amount (15). No maximum value.

account_name.description: Name of beneficiary as given with account

x-description.swift: Field 59A: Beneficiary customer name and address (140)

x-description.sepa: Must be in IBAN format

account_type.description: The type of the account given with `beneficiary_party.account_number`. Single digit number. Only required if requested by the beneficiary party. Defaults to 0.

x-description.fps: Single digit number. Only required if requested by the beneficiary party. Defaults to 0.

x-description.sepa: Max 2 lines of 70 text
x-description.swift: Field 59A: Beneficiary customer name and address (140)

x-description.sepa: If a Beneficiary Identification is used then only one of `beneficiary_party.organisation_identification`, `beneficiary_party.private_identification` or date and place of birth can be present.

birth_country.description: Beneficiary birth country, ISO 3166 format country code

organisation_identification.description: Organisation identification of a beneficiary, used in the case that the beneficiary is an organisation and not a private person

x-description.sepa: The Identification can either be a BIC, BEI or Other Identification

organisation_identification_code.description: The code that specifies the type of `organisation_identification`

x-description.sepa: May only be present if `beneficiary_party.organisation_identification_code` is `Other`

category_purpose.description: Category purpose in proprietary form. Specifies the high level purpose of the instruction. Cannot be used at the same time as `category_purpose_coded`.

category_purpose_coded.description: Category purpose in a coded form. Specifies the high level purpose of the instruction. Cannot be used at the same time as `category_purpose`.

x-description.sepa: The codes used must be part of the ISO 20022 ExternalCategoryPurpose1Code list

clearing_id.description: Unique identifier for organisations collecting payments

currency.description: Currency of the transaction amount. Currency code as defined in [ISO 4217](http://www.iso.org/iso/home/standards/currency_codes.htm)

x-description.sepa: Must be `EUR`

account_name.description: Name of debtor as given with account

account_number.description: Debtor account number. Allows upper case and numeric characters.

x-description.fps: Domestic account number if `account_number_code` is `BBAN`, IBAN if `account_number_code` is `IBAN`
x-description.sepa: Must be in IBAN format.
Max 2 lines of 70 text.

If a Debtor Identification is used then only one of `debtor_party.organisation_identification`, `debtor_party.private_identification` or date and place of birth can be present.

country.description: Country of debtor address. ISO 3166 format country code"

customer_id.description: SWIFT BIC for ordering customer, either BIC8 or BIC11

x-description.swift: Field 50A: Ordering customer name and address (140)

organisation_identification.description: Organisation identification of a debtor, in the case that the debtor is an organisation and not a private person

x-description.sepa: The Identification can either be a BIC, BEI or Other Identification

organisation_identification_code.description: The code that specifies the type of `organisation_identification`

x-description.sepa: If `debtor_party.organisation_identification` is specified, must be one of `BIC`, `BEI`, `BANK`, `CBID`, `CHID`, `CINC`, `COID`, `CUST`, `DUNS`, `EMPL`, `GS1G`, `SREN`, `SRET`, `TXID` or `Other`
May only be present if `debtor_party.organisation_identification_code` is `Other`

end_to_end_reference.description: Unique identification, as assigned by the initiating party, to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain.

x-description.sepa: In the event that no reference was given, `NOTPROVIDED` must be used.

contract_reference.description: Reference to the foreign exchange contract associated with the transaction

exchange_rate.description: Factor used to convert an amount from the instructed currency into the transaction currency: i.e. to convert the `fx.original_amount`, expressed in the `fx.original_currency`, to `amount` specified in `currency`. Decimal value, represented as a string, maximum length 12. Must be > 0.

x-description.sepa: If the instructed currency is not `EUR`: `fx.exchange_rate`, `fx.original_amount` and `fx.original_currency` must be provided

original_amount.description: Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as instructed by the initiating party. Decimal value. Must be > 0.

x-description.sepa: If the instructed currency is not `EUR`: `fx.exchange_rate`, `fx.original_amount` and `fx.original_currency` must be provided.

original_currency.description: Currency of `original_amount`. Currency code as defined in ISO 4217.

x-description.sepa: If the instructed currency is not `EUR`: `fx.exchange_rate`, `fx.original_amount` and `fx.original_currency` must be provided.

instruction_id.description: Unique identification, as assigned by the initiating party to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is an point-to-point reference and is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire chain. Cannot include leading, trailing or internal spaces.

x-description.sepa: Cannot include leading, trailing or internal spaces

numeric_reference.description: Numeric reference field, see scheme specific descriptions for usage

x-description.bacs: Field7: Reference field used for UK tax info and Bacs Returns

payment_acceptance_datetime.description: Timestamp of when the payment instruction meets the set processing conditions. Format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss:mmm+hh:mm

payment_purpose.description: Purpose of the payment in a proprietary form

x-description.fps: FPS Procedures do not mandate any values for the use of this field

payment_purpose_coded.description: Purpose of the payment in a coded form

x-description.sepa: The codes used must be part of the ISO 20022 ExternalPurpose1Code list.

payment_scheme.description: Clearing infrastructure through which the payment instruction is to be processed. Default for given organisation ID is used if left empty. Has to be a valid [scheme identifier](http://draft-api-docs.form3.tech/api.html#enumerations-schemes).

x-description.bacs: `BACS` or empty if default for organisation is `BACS`
x-description.fps: `FPS` or empty if default for organisation is `FPS`
x-description.sepa: `SEPAINSTANT` or empty if default for organisation is `SEPAINSTANT`

processing_date.description: Date on which the payment is to be debited from the debtor account. Formatted according to ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.

x-description.fps: Must be within +/- 1 day of today
x-description.sepa: Ignored

x-description.fps: Short reference information associated with the payment. The beneficiary bank must pass on this information to beneficiary. 18 characters max, must match ^[A-Za-z0-9 /\-]{1,18}$.

regulatory_reporting.example: May be required for some foreign originated payments

remittance_information.description: Information supplied to enable the matching of an entry with the items that the transfer is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts receivable system provided by the debtor for the beneficiary.
remittance_information.example: Additional remittance information over and above reference information

x-description.fps: Longer reference information associated with the payment.
x-description.sepa: Either the structured remittance information `structured_reference` or unstructured `remittance_information` may be present but not both.
x-description.swift: Field 70: Remittance Information (140 less /RFB/ or /ROC/ elements if present)

x-description.bacs: Has to be valid payment type for Bacs Direct Credit

scheme_processing_date.description: Date on which the payment is processed by the scheme. Only used if different from `processing_date`.

x-description.bacs: Field12. Usually day 2 of the Bacs cycle, only populated on incoming payments.

scheme_transaction_id.description: Unique identification, as assigned by the first instructing agent, to unambiguously identify the transaction that is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire interbank chain.

x-description.fps: Corresponds to the Transaction Reference Number (TRN)
x-description.sepa: Cannot include leading, trailing or internal spaces

Either the structured remittance information `structured_reference` or unstructured `remittance_information` may be present but not both. Mandatory if `SCOR` is used in the remittance data proprietary code.

reference.description: Unique reference to unambiguously refer to the payment originated by the creditor, this reference enables reconciliation by the creditor upon receipt of the amount of money.

x-description.sepa: Either the structured remittance information `structured_reference` or unstructured `remittance_information` may be present but not both.

destination.description: Destination SWIFT logical terminal address. Complete 12-character SWIFT destination, including BIC (x8), logical terminal code (x1) and branch code (x).

message_type.description: The message type of the SWIFT payment, has to match `[A-Z]{2}[0-9]{3}`. Currently `MT103` is the only supported value

recipient.description: The destination SWIFT BIC for SWIFT MT messages being sent by Form3 client to SWIFT. Formatted as BIC8 or BIC11.

source.description: The source SWIFT BIC for SWIFT MT messages being received by Form3 client from SWIFT. Formatted as BIC8 or BIC11.

user_reference.description: Message User Reference (MUR) value, which can be up to 16 characters, and will be returned in the ACK

sender_receiver_information.description: This field specifies additional information for the Receiver or other party specified.

x-description.swift:
Field 72 Line 1 /RETN/, Line 2 value follows Payment Return Code. Unless bilaterally agreed otherwise between the Sender and the Receiver, one of the following codes must be used in Code, placed between slashes (`/`):
- ACC Account with institution
- INS Instructing institution
- INT Intermediary institution
- REC Receiver

time_indication.description: This repetitive field specifies one or several time indication(s) related to the processing of the payment instruction.

unique_scheme_id.description: The scheme-specific unique transaction ID. Populated by the scheme.

x-description.fps: Corresponds to the FPID, only present for incoming payments or after payment has been submitted to the scheme.

scheme_status_code.description: Refers to individual scheme where applicable

token_type.description: The type of the token. Is always set to `Bearer`.

x-description.sepa: Max 2 lines of 70 text.
If a Ultimate Beneficiary/Debtor Identification is used then only one of `organisation_identification`, `private_identification` or date and place of birth can be present.

birth_country.description: Ultimate debtor/beneficiary birth country. ISO 3166 format country code

x-description.sepa: If a Ultimate Beneficiary/Debtor Identification is used then only one of `organisation_identification`, `private_identification` or date and place of birth can be present.

birth_date.description: Ultimate debtor/beneficiary birth date. Formatted ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DD

x-description.sepa: If a Ultimate Beneficiary/Debtor Identification is used then only one of `organisation_identification`, `private_identification` or date and place of birth can be present.
If a Ultimate Beneficiary/Debtor Identification is used then only one of `organisation_identification`, `private_identification` or date and place of birth can be present.

country.description: Country of ultimate debtor/beneficiary address. ISO 3166 format country code

organisation_identification.description: Organisation identification of an ultimate debtor/beneficiary, in the case that the ultimate debtor/beneficiary is an organisation and not a private person.

x-description.sepa: The Identification can either be a BIC, BEI or Other Identification

organisation_identification_code.description: The code that specifies the type of `organisation_identification`

x-description.sepa: If `organisation_identification` is specified, must be one of `BIC`, `BEI`, `BANK`, `CBID`, `CHID`, `CINC`, `COID`, `CUST`, `DUNS`, `EMPL`, `GS1G`, `SREN`, `SRET`, `TXID` or `Other`
May only be present if `organisation_identification_code` is `Other`

organisation_identification_scheme.description: The code that specifies the scheme of `organisation_identification`

x-description.sepa: May only be present if `organisation_identification_code` is `Other`

SecondaryIdentification.description:
The payment reference information as input by the payer.
This must always be included, where available, for all CoP requests as the payees ASPSP may need to use secondary reference data input in this field to identify the underlying account in its books.
